New Records: Pakistan's big chase surpassed Ireland's previous Cricket World Cup record, in which it made 7-329 to beat England in 2011.
Key Match Events: Mohammad Rizwan scored an unbeaten 131 off 121 balls.
Pakistan reached 345-4 with 10 balls to spare.
Post-Match Reflections: Rizwan expressed pride in the team's performance and belief in their ability to chase the target.
Sri Lanka's captain Dasun Shanaka mentioned that the team was 20-25 runs short and acknowledged the bowling challenges.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sri Lanka has had plenty of bowling problems at the World Cup in the absence of injured star leg spinner Wanindu Hasaranga.
Pakistan stretched its World Cup record against Sri Lanka to 8-0 and has four points from two victories.
